pageContext.claim: “And also, everything that they could possibly have at their disposal. There was nobody that was, in the history of our country, more transparent than me. I said: ‘Give them every document. Give them every person. Let the White House Counsel testify.’ I think he testified for 30 hours. I guess they must have asked him the same question because there wasn't much to testify about. … I gave them 1.5 million documents.”
pageContext.analysis: Special counsel Robert Mueller's report lays out evidence of several potential obstruction-of-justice offenses by the president, including attempts by Trump to remove Mueller and curtail the investigation, and actions that Mueller said could influence witness testimony. Trump declined interview requests and his written answers to questions were called insufficient in Mueller's report.
